text: 🚨 Energy crisis: Who has the priciest electricity and gas in Europe? 💡After Russia's invasion of Ukraine, electricity and gas prices soared. But which countries have the highest and lowest prices in Europe? 🤔The answer might surprise you! 😱🇩🇪 Germany has the most expensive electricity in Europe, with an average price of €0.32 per kWh! 💸🇫🇷 France has the second highest electricity prices, followed by 🇮🇹 Italy and 🇪🇸 Spain. 🤝But when it comes to natural gas, 🇩🇰 Denmark takes the cake with an average price of €13.4 per 100 kWh! 🍰🇳🇱 Netherlands has the second highest natural gas prices, followed by 🇧🇬 Bulgaria and 🇭🇷 Croatia. 🌎And guess what? 🤔 The EU's dependence on Russian natural gas imports has decreased significantly since the invasion. 💪So, who has the cheapest electricity and gas in Europe? 🤔🇲🇰 North Macedonia has the cheapest natural gas prices, followed by 🇧🇦 Bosnia and Herzegovina. 🌟But remember, the true cost of energy goes beyond price. 🌎 It's time to invest in renewable energy sources and reduce our dependence on fossil fuels! 💚
